intro: Silene montana subsp. typica, commonly known as the mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Silene montana subsp. typica is often found in alpine meadows and is a common species in the subalpine zone.
